Trinity::

She looked at both bots. She turned and looked around.  She saw a 
mouse and smiled.  She wanted to hunt. "Well, if you two want to talk 
a while...I'll be right."  She turned and dashed off after the 
mouse.  She ran threw the thickets and under the tall bushes.  She 
ran around the tall trees and under a few fallen logs.  She made a 
mad leap and pounced on the mouse.  She looked at it in her paws and 
smiled.  "Hah! Caught ya."  She smiled as the mouse struggled trying 
to get away.  She picked up the mouse and was about to eat it when 
she thought about the mouse. Maybe this mouse had a family to take 
care of. She sighed and looked at the mouse. "Today is your lucky day 
rodent." She let the mouse go and watched it scurry off. She sighed 
and started to walk back to the others.  She looked around and saw 
nothing but trees all around. She couldn't find the trail that she 
had taken to get to this point. So sighed and muttered,"Oh yeah, he's 
going to skin me alive this time."  She sniffed around and tried to 
follow her nose back to where she was.  She followed a path that 
looked like it was cut out of the forest, but a long time ago and had 
grown over a bit.  She walked along and made her way slowly through 
the forest. Her childlike curiosity was getting the better of her.  
She kept going until she came up to a strange cave. She walked inside 
and looked around.  It was dark, but there was a hole in the top that 
let in some light.  She smelled the smell of old death inside the 
cave. 



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Rudra656@a... wrote:
> ::Aerotaur::
>       "Is there something you're not telling us?  What's the big 
hurry?  We 
> don't even know where we're going."
